title: Arm Triangle Choke (From Side Control — Sprawl Finish)

taxonomy.Variety: Sprawl Finish Arm Triangle From Side Control

labels.Entity Name: Arm Triangle Choke (From Side Control — Sprawl Finish)
labels.Translation: Shoulder Hold / Arm-and-Head Choke (From Side Control)
labels.Aliases: Side Control Arm Triangle (Sprawl) | Side Kata Gatame (Sprawl) | Head-and-Arm (Side, Sprawl)
labels.Description: A side-control kata gatame finished with a full or partial sprawl. The attacker drives shoulder and chest pressure beside the defender’s head while sprawling the legs back to load weight through the ribcage and neck. The sprawl removes the defender’s bridge power and tightens carotid compression with minimal arm effort.
labels.Biomechanical Mechanism: Action | Shoulder/chest compression with defender’s arm as wedge || Joints Affected | Neck (carotid arteries); shoulder (secondary) || Forces | Downward shoulder pressure, lateral chest squeeze, hip sprawl to anchor weight
labels.Position / Entry Examples: From side control, thread under the far arm and push it across the face; drop head low next to the trapped arm, lock gable or palm-to-bicep, then sprawl hips and “look away” while walking hips slightly toward the head to seal the choke.
labels.Martial Arts Used In: BJJ | Judo | Sambo | Submission Grappling | MMA
labels.Danger Rating: Danger: 9/10 | Direct vascular choke; fast once shoulder depth is set.
labels.Legality in Competition: IBJJF: Legal | Judo: Legal | Sambo: Legal | MMA: Legal | Submission Grappling: Legal
labels.Variants: Variants	Full sprawl finish (direct neck / over-the-arm thread) || Half-sprawl with hip walk || Walk-around to north-south for tighter angle
labels.Training Notes: Head deep first, then sprawl—don’t loosen your lock during movement. Keep ear-to-mat by the trapped arm, block far hip with your knee/hand, and finish with chest/shoulder pressure, not arms alone.
labels.History / Origin:
Classical kata gatame finishing angle taught in Judo; widely adopted in BJJ/MMA for its high control-to-finish ratio.
Common Mistakes	Arriving too high over the head || Allowing elbow to slip back across chest || Squeezing with arms only || Not turning the head/shoulders to close space
labels.Common Mistakes: Not dropping head low enough || Allowing opponent’s elbow to slip free || Trying to finish flat instead of angling chest || Squeezing with arms only instead of chest/shoulder
labels.Effectiveness: Very high—natural angle and sprawl neutralize common escapes.
labels.Related Techniques: Arm Triangle from Mount || Mount-to-Side Arm Triangle Transition || North-South Arm Triangle || D’Arce Choke (if arm slips)
labels.Tags: side control kata gatame sprawl | arm triangle side sprawl | head-and-arm choke side control | BJJ | Judo | Sambo | MMA
labels.Notes: Side control angle often provides the tightest finish for Kata Gatame; many athletes set choke from mount then dismount to side for completion.
